spanishExample: ¿Cómo le va? Quise *to talk* con usted esta mañana.
englishTranslation: (Formal) How is it going? I meant to talk with you this morning.
vocabIncluded: cómo le va: how's it going? (formal) (idiom)
usted: formal "you" after a preposition (prep. pronoun)

spanishExample: ¿Cómo les va? No los he *seen* since ese entonces.
englishTranslation: (All of you) How is it going? I haven't seen you since back then.
vocabIncluded: cómo les va: how's it going? (plural) (idiom)
he: "have", "I have" before a participle (Haber, present, 1st person)

spanishExample: ¿Cómo te va? Quisimos tenerte aquí ese día.
englishTranslation: How is it going? We meant to have you here that day.
vocabIncluded: cómo te va: how's it going? (idiom)

spanishExample: A veces quieren hacer eso al mismo tiempo.
englishTranslation: Sometimes they want to do that at the same time.
vocabIncluded: al mismo tiempo: "at the same time" (idiom)

spanishExample: Ella *hopes* que yo quiera lo que ella ha querido.
englishTranslation: She hopes I want what she has wanted.
vocabIncluded: "lo que": "what" as a connector between phrases
"que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
ha: "has", "he/she/it has" before a participle (Haber, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Ella quería que yo lo quisiera.
englishTranslation: She wanted me to want it.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)

spanishExample: Ella quiere que yo lo quiera.
englishTranslation: She wants me to want it.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)

spanishExample: Era momento de *give them* lo que querían.
englishTranslation: It was the moment to give them what they wanted.
vocabIncluded: "lo que": "what" as a connector between phrases

spanishExample: Es tiempo de tener lo que quieres.
englishTranslation: It’s time for you to have what you want.
vocabIncluded: "lo que": "what" as a connector between phrases

spanishExample: Este mes puede que queramos estar seguros.
englishTranslation: This month it might be that we want to be sure.
vocabIncluded: seguro: adjective meaning "sure" when used with Estar

spanishExample: Estoy seguro de que lo harían si quisieran.
englishTranslation: I’m sure they’d do it if they wanted.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
quisieran: "wanted", "they wanted" (Querer, past subjunctive, 3rd person plural)
seguro: adjective meaning "sure" when used with Estar

spanishExample: *I hope* que ella quiera ir una vez que estemos mejor.
englishTranslation: I hope she wants to go once we are better.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
una vez que: idiom meaning "once", right before another phrase

spanishExample: *I hope* que no quieras irte.
englishTranslation: I hope you don’t want to leave.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)

spanishExample: No estoy seguro de que quieran ir a la vez.
englishTranslation: I’m not sure(m) they want to go at once.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
seguro: adjective meaning "sure" when used with Estar

spanishExample: No queríamos esa casa, pero tú la querías.
englishTranslation: We didn’t want that house, but you wanted it.

spanishExample: No quisieras estar ahí.
englishTranslation: You wouldn’t want to be there.
vocabIncluded: ahí: adverb meaning "there", especially when close to the speaker or listener
quisieras: "would want", "you would want" (Querer, conditional, 2nd person)

spanishExample: No te quiso *to hurt,* así que tiempo al tiempo.
englishTranslation: He didn’t mean to hurt you, so give it time.

spanishExample: Queríamos a nuestros amigos.
englishTranslation: We loved our friends.
vocabIncluded: "the personal a": using an extra "a" before a direct object when it's a person

spanishExample: Quiere lo mismo que yo quería.
englishTranslation: He wants the same thing that I wanted.
vocabIncluded: "lo": "the" with no noun, as in "lo bueno"

spanishExample: Quiero tener dónde estar solo de vez en cuando.
englishTranslation: I want to have a place to be alone(m) once in a while.
vocabIncluded: de vez en cuando: "once in a while" (idiom)

spanishExample: Quisieron hacer una fiesta, pero ella no quería.
englishTranslation: They meant to throw a party, but she didn’t want to.

spanishExample: Si quisiéramos ir, iríamos, pero no queremos.
englishTranslation: If we wanted to go, we would go, but we don’t want to.
vocabIncluded: quisiéramos: "wanted", "we wanted" (Querer, past subjunctive, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Si tú quisieras ir y yo quisiera ir, las dos iríamos.
englishTranslation: If you wanted to go and I wanted to go, we both(f) would go.

spanishExample: Tengo un momento ya mismo.
englishTranslation: I have a moment this instant.

spanishExample: Vamos a querer esto.
englishTranslation: We’re going to want this.
vocabIncluded: using Ir and "a" to put verbs in the future (e.g. "voy a ser")
